conclusion: Determine which container the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Arrows at A, B, and C indicate the direction of liquid flow.
Baffles are arranged to direct the flow of liquid using colors and positions.
Liquid from A will encounter the brown baffle first, directing it downward.
Liquid from A will flow past the black baffle, which does not obstruct its path.
Liquid from A will continue downward and flow into container D.
Liquid from B will encounter the cyan baffle first, directing it downward.
Liquid from B will flow past the purple baffle, which does not obstruct its path.
Liquid from B will continue downward and flow into container D.
Liquid from C will encounter the orange baffle first, directing it downward.
Liquid from C will flow past the white baffle, which does not obstruct its path.
Liquid from C will continue downward and flow into container D.
All flows from A, B, and C are directed downward and will flow into container D.
The liquid will flow into container D after passing through the baffles.
